ferus_sanchar: a fancy new networking stack for Ferus It includes a URL parser and HTTP client. Currently, it relies on std/httpclient but there'll be a proper backend later on.

import ferus_sanchar

let httpClient = newSancharHTTPClient()
var parser = newURLParser()

let url = parser.parse("https://example.org")

echo "Connecting to: " & $url

let resp = httpClient.fetch(url)

echo resp.body

ferus_sanchar/http/http, ferus_sanchar/responseutils, ferus_sanchar/sanchar, ferus_sanchar/telemetry, ferus_sanchar/url

Procs

proc parseUrl(s: string): URL {....raises: [ValueError, KeyError], tags: [].}
Helper function to quickly parse a URL Try to avoid it when possible as it allocates a new URLParser for every call.
import ferus_sanchar

let url = parseUrl("https://github.com")
